{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3069592,"name":"Elliot Scher","username":"Gandagorn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gandagorn/{size}/267112_2.png","created_at":"2022-06-19T00:26:54.393Z","cooked":"

I’m trying to build a small scale robot and I don’t have the funding for all the traditional frc control parts (rio, pdp etc.) are there other ways to control a robot on a smaller scale? I was thinking with raspberry pi but i’m not sure. The main thing is that I would like to be able to write the code for it using wpilib so I’m not sure whether there are other systems that support that.

Is the VMX Pi still a thing?

It doesn’t appear to be sold anymore. The replacement seems to be the VMX Robotics Controller, but it costs $400 (so nearly as much as a Rio).

See my post here for what I’ve looked into online. The Romi really is a great option.

NI Guest Blog - roboRIO 2.0 General Forum
This is indeed a challenge with multiple causes, both technical and economic. If it was easy, we would already have a solution, right? Here’s my quick look at the current lay of the current land. This is a simplistic view, of course; this space gets a lot more complicated when you add everything else needed to actually build a FTC scale robot, like motor controllers and power distribution. I tried to capture it where I could below based on quick website searches, but of cours…
